br.strong:
Robertson County Schools: Closed
Schools will be closed for the remainder of the
2019-2020 school year.

img.title: Doctor causey headshot
img.p: This is Dr. Chris Causey, Director of Schools. Based on Governor Lee’s recommendation, Robertson County Schools will be closed for the remainder of the school year. We understand that this decision involves the postponement of many end of the year activities. Please know, that graduation ceremonies for the Class of 2020 will take place. We will be sending out date options soon so that families can begin setting their calendars. Many events including proms, senior recognitions and other important occasions will be rescheduled for a time in which it is safe for students and guests. Details will be communicated as they are developed. Our feeding program and academic resources and lessons will continue until May 22nd. The school year is not over even though the buildings may be closed. Your teachers and others will continue to communicate with you, provide learning opportunities, and ensure your nutritional needs are met during this time.

Lastly, I would like to say to our seniors how truly sorry I am for the way the end of your last year as a Robertson County student has transpired. We are so proud of you as you get ready to graduate and move on to the next chapter of your life. I look forward to the day when I shake your hand, give you your diploma, and watch you as you move your tassel. That day will come.
Blessings to you all, and we will continue to be in touch.

p.span: During this unprecedented time, the primary concern of the school district is the health and safety of everyone in our school family and in our community. In response, we have organized emergency feeding sites throughout the county for all students. These sites will begin operation on Monday, March 23. Additionally, we are opening the Family Resource & Parent Center on a limited basis to assist with family needs. The district website contains details on these programs as well as a listing of other county resources.

hr.p: Following spring break, we are providing students and families with academic resources to keep students engaged while we are out of school. For March 23 - March 31, academic enrichment activities have been posted to the district website for student and family use.

Students are provided 30 minutes of instruction beyond the state requirement during each school day. This extra time allows the district to stockpile days. Stockpiled days will meet state instructional requirements through April 1. The State Department of Education will provide districts with guidance to develop instructional plans if needed for an extended school closure. We are committed to maintaining clear communication and providing needed resources to all employees and families throughout this difficult time.
If you have any questions, please call the district office or reach out to me by email.

Sincerely,
Dr. Chris Causey
Director of Schools

Durante este tiempo sin precedentes, la principal preocupación del distrito escolar es la salud y la seguridad de todos en nuestra familia escolar y en nuestra comunidad. En respuesta, hemos organizado sitios de alimentación de emergencia en todo el condado para todos los estudiantes. Estos sitios comenzarán el Lunes, 23 de Marzo. Además, estamos abriendo el Centro de Recursos para Familias y Padres de forma limitada para ayudar con las necesidades de la familia. El sitio web del distrito contiene detalles sobre estos programas, así como una lista de otros recursos del condado.

Después de las vacaciones de primavera, proporcionamos a los estudiantes y las familias recursos académicos para mantener a los estudiantes interesados mientras estamos fuera de la escuela. Del 23 al 31 de Marzo, se han publicado actividades de enriquecimiento académico en el sitio web del distrito para uso de los estudiantes y sus familias.

Los estudiantes reciben 30 minutos de instrucción más allá del requisito estatal durante cada día escolar. Este tiempo extra le permite al distrito acumular días. Los días almacenados cumplirán con los requisitos de instrucción del estado hasta el 1 de Abril. El Departamento de Educación del Estado proporcionará a los distritos orientación para desarrollar planes de instrucción si es necesario para un cierre prolongado de la escuela. Estamos comprometidos a mantener una comunicación clara y proporcionar los recursos necesarios a todos los empleados y familias durante este momento difícil.
Si tiene alguna pregunta, llame a la oficina del distrito o comuníquese conmigo por correo electrónico.

Sinceramente,
Dr. Chris Causey
Director de las Escuelas

tr.td: There’s something for every student. Educational games have different levels so the practice can be customized. The site has areas dedicated to math and reading.
Discover this well‐organized, kid‐friendly resource for fun facts and outstanding games and quizzes.

Created by a math teacher, this site offers games that require specific and complex skills, logic puzzles and an amazing supply of word problems. The games use manipulatives to help make even the most abstract math concepts clear.
In addition to PBS character sections (Maya and Miguel, Word Girl) there are terrific sections dedicated to the American Experience: Wayback, Democracy Project, History Detectives and more.
Take a closer look at these engaging online exhibits from the Smithsonian Institution covering art, science & nature, history & culture and people & places.

Presented by the Library of Congress, students will get caught up in the interactivity of the site as they Meet Amazing Americans, Jump Back in Time, Explore the States, Join America at Play and See, Hear and Sing. Check it out.
Online textbooks adopted by Robertson County Schools
Looking for a good book? Check out this site with reviews and recommendations as well as sections devoted to popular book series.
Perfect for pre‐readers and beginning readers, this site takes a systematic phonics approach and combines it with phonemic awareness practice.
Check out this site for hundreds of book reviews, information on the most popular series, lists of the best graphic novels and the Ultimate Reading List. Everyone can find a good book on this site.
Check out this site for picture books and early reading books that can be narrated in both English and Spanish!
Listen to famous actors read books to students. There are also activity guides for each book. Videos are on Youtube or Vimeo.
Access over 400,000 resources including books, magazines, videos, podcast, test prep and more!
Fun site for kids “up to 10.” Solve jigsaw puzzles, color online, improve yourcoordination and more.
Don’t lose those hard‐earned math skills. Check out Cool Math to practice pre‐algebra and algebra.
Students practice at their own pace, first filling in gaps in their understanding and then accelerating their learning.

The Tennessee Department of Education and Governor’s Early Literacy Foundation (GELF) announced a statewide partnership with ReadyRosie, an early education online platform, to provide short videos and free resources with simple, engaging activities for Tennessee families and children, ages birth through 3rd grade, to do at home
